column4: hi.  for some reason, none of my accounts can use 'su' anymore.  I can log in via root and su to any user, but when logged in as a non-root user i cannot su to root (or any other user).  any ideas?
visudo and figure out the allowed users to sudo
listed as all
still doesn't mean anything why user nonadmin1 can't su to nonadmin2, either
which line entry?
hold, i need to juggle screens
: %admin ALL=(ALL) ALL
all my users are in admin by default.
and no one can sudo as root?
no one can sudo, no one can su (to either root, or to any non-root user either)
another symptom may be a fact that wpasupplicant does not start, nor do usbdrives and optical drives automount either.  don't know if those are connected.
and you used visudo to change that file right not like using a vim or emacs?
visudo, vi
dont use just vi  you must use visudo
i mean, i did use visudo.  i havent changed anything in the file
how did you su to another user?
either 'su -' to su to root, or 'su - otheruser'.
that sounds right..hmmm
can you ssh in to localhost  as the other user?
let me screen this and try.  bbiaf.
i can log in via ssh (and normal boot).
